page.title: 07Burton Pidsea People - 2
page.content: MRS. WRIGHT A group of children went to interview Mrs. Wright at her home. She was born in the Nancy Inn and she has lived in the village all her life. When she was born the Nancy Inn was a blacksmith's, not a pub. The pub. was in Cross Keys' Cottage which is next to the church. She was married in 1926 and during the war she changed her living room into a shop. She closed the shop when her husband died. Her Grandfather was the village carrier and, today, Wright's Haulage Contractors are still based in the village. Mrs. Wright used to know all the people in the village when she was small but now it has grown bigger there are many that she doesn't know.
